SEARCH
Package ruclinic

Class Date

java.lang.Object
ruclinic.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Date>
public class Date extends Object implements Comparable<Date>
Verify if the dates are valid based on the following order The date of an appointment is  an invalid calendar date,  today,  a date before today  a date on Saturday or Sunday  a date not within six months from today.
Author:
Kaiming Chen

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Date(String date)
    isValid() method checks whether the date is a valid calendar date Check is it 1 or 2 digits for day and month Check is it 4 digits for year Check for month 1,3,5,7,8,10,12 is till 31 Check for month 4,6,9,11 is till 30 Check

    • Date

      public Date(String date)
      isValid() method checks whether the date is a valid calendar date Check is it 1 or 2 digits for day and month Check is it 4 digits for year Check for month 1,3,5,7,8,10,12 is till 31 Check for month 4,6,9,11 is till 30 Check

  • Method Details

    • isToday

      public boolean isToday()
      isToday() method is used to check if the date is today, could be used for appointment making and also used to check if a birthday is valid or not
      Returns:
      whether or not date given is today

      public String isValidAppointmentDate()
      Checks if the date is a valid appointment Date Cannot be before today, cannot be beyond six months and cannot be saturday or sunday

    • leap_year

      public int leap_year()
      Checks to see if the year is a leap year or not
      Returns:
      integer for if it is leap year 1, not a leap year 0

    • leap_year_correct_days

      public boolean leap_year_correct_days()
      Checks to see if there are correct amount of days for leap and non-leap year
      Returns:
      a boolean value to check if true it is correct days for leap or non-leap year false for incorrect year of leap or non-leap year

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Checks to see if the date is valid based on if it is larger than 1900 if there are correct number of days in leap year if there are correct days in each month if the month is correct
      Returns:
      a boolean to see if the date is valid, true for valid and false for nonvalid
